Transcription for 461054

I went to see Robert Jones, the scrum half, in a businessman's lunch in Paltn Frithes just before Christmas.
And I went up to Robert after the match and I said, you know, there's one thing better than rugby.
And he looked at me and he said, what's that? I said, talking about it.
I said, because the talking about it and the stories, I think, are absolutely brilliant.
And that's the same with all sport. I love tuning in for the football on 606 on a Saturday evening
to listen to the people giving their opinions and people phoning in and giving their opinions
and the commentators replying to it. And that's part of it with sport, the stories.
And I'm not sure all the stories are accurate after 20 years or 30 years.
